newsitem.title: CANADA: Thunder Bay vessel clearances - April 22.
newsitem.headline: Thunder Bay vessel clearances - April 22.

text.p: Daily vessel loading/clearances at Thunder Bay, Ontario:
Date Vessel Cargo (MT) Status Destination
April 18 Mangal Desai 18,500 wht Clred4/18 Foreign Pt
April 18 Windoc 25,000 wht Clred4/18 Stl Ports
April 18 Solta 17,000 solin Clred4/18 Foreign Pt
April 18 Catherine Desgnes 8,000 wht Clred4/18
Goderich/Long Pond
April 19 Sarah Spencer 19,000 m/wht Cleard4/19PColborne
April 20 Mapleglen 23,000 wht/can Cleard4/20Foreign Pt
April 21 Ziemia Chelminska 18,000 wht Load 4/21 Foreign Pt
April 21 Algowest 28,000 wht Load 4/21 Stl Ports
April 21 Mantadoc 14,000 can Load 4/21 Windsor
April 21 Canadian Prospector 16,000 wht Load 4/21 Stl Ports
April 21 Ziemia Zamojska -- -- En route Foreign Pt
April 21 Cartierdoc 25,000 -- Due 4/21 Stl Ports
April 23 Canadian Miner 18,000 can/? Due 4/23 3
Rivers/Que/Windsor
April 23 Sarah Spencer 18,500 m/wht Due 4/23 Midland
April 23 Lake Erie -- -- Due 4/23 Foreign Pt
April 23 Canadian Leader 18,000 -- Due 4/23 Stl Ports
April 24 Nanticoke 25,000 m/wht Due 4/24 Halifax
April 25 Mayovitza -- flax Due 4/25 Foreign Pt
April 25 Quebecois 25,000 -- Due 4/25 Stl Ports
April 27 Federal MacKenzie -- -- Due 4/27 Foreign Pt
May 2 Milan Kamak -- -- Due 5/2 Foreign Pt
NOTE: Thunder Bay reopened April 1 when H.M. Griffith cleared.
Source: Lake Shippers Clearance Assn.
Note wht=wheat, can=canola, m/wht=milling wheat, M=meal,
P=pellets, O=oil. Ready=preparing to load. MT=metric tonne.
Stl Ports=St Lawrence Ports. Wind=Windsor.
((Gilbert Le Gras 204 947 3548))
